brainly_data.question:
What is the primary goal and secondary goal of the Fried Liver Opening in chess? 
A. To draw the king out into the center
B. To weaken the opponents queen side.
C. To take an extra piece.
D. To trade the queen for a rook.
E. To take advantage of the weak f7 square.
brainly_data.subject: Arts

all_answers.question:
What is the primary goal and secondary goal of the Fried Liver Opening in chess? 
A. To draw the king out into the center
B. To weaken the opponents queen side.
C. To take an extra piece.
D. To trade the queen for a rook.
E. To take advantage of the weak f7 square.
all_answers.subject: Arts
all_answers.text: The goal is to draw out the opposing king (answer A) so you can then advance to the secondary goal of taking advantage of the weak square (which differs according to which variation you are using) f7 (answer E)

top_answer.subject: Arts
top_answer.text: The goal is to draw out the opposing king (answer A) so you can then advance to the secondary goal of taking advantage of the weak square (which differs according to which variation you are using) f7 (answer E)
